alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 5:41PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WINDOW ROCK ON THE NAVAJO NATION THROUGH 615 PM MST... At 540 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Window Rock, or 20 miles northwest of Gallup, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Defiance, Window Rock Airport, Window Rock, and St. Michaels. This includes State Route 264 between mile markers 469 and 475. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
